info.title: Posterrama API
info.description: Posterrama aggregates media from Plex, Jellyfin, TMDB, RomM, and local libraries to create dynamic poster galleries.

externalDocs.description: Full documentation, setup guides, and tutorials

tags.name: API v1
tags.description: **Modern RESTful API** (Preferred) - Clean, versioned endpoints following REST best practices. Use these for all new integrations. Includes `/api/v1/config`, `/api/v1/media`, `/api/v1/media/{key}`, `/api/v1/devices/*`.

tags.name: Public API
tags.description: **Core endpoints** for fetching media and configuration. No authentication required. Examples: GET /get-media, GET /health

tags.name: Frontend
tags.description: **Display pages** (/screensaver, /cinema, /wallart) and admin interface (/admin). Returns HTML with embedded configurations.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: **Session-based auth** with optional 2FA. Login flow: POST /login → Cookie → POST /logout. Supports Bearer tokens for API access.

tags.name: Security
tags.description: **Security monitoring** including CSP violation reporting, rate limiting, and login attempt tracking. Admin-only endpoints.

tags.name: Admin
tags.description: **System management** including config backups, server restarts, and health monitoring. All endpoints require sessionAuth or bearerAuth.

tags.name: Configuration
tags.description: **Application settings** for media sources (Plex/Jellyfin/TMDB), display modes (screensaver/cinema/wallart), and server options. Supports config backups.

tags.name: Validation
tags.description: **Test connections** to Plex/Jellyfin/TMDB servers before saving config. Returns detailed error messages on failure.

tags.name: Devices
tags.description: **Device lifecycle** → Register POST /api/devices/register, pair with code POST /api/devices/pair, control via WebSocket /ws/devices. Rate limited: 5 req/min.

tags.name: Profiles
tags.description: **Device profiles** for display settings. Create profiles POST /api/profiles, assign to devices. All display settings are stored in profiles.

tags.name: Local Directory
tags.description: **Offline media** from ZIP posterpack archives or directory scans. Upload POST /local-posterpack/upload, list GET /local-posterpack/:zipName/list.

tags.name: Cache
tags.description: **Performance optimization** with multi-tier caching (memory + disk). View stats GET /api/cache/stats, clear cache POST /api/cache/clear.

tags.name: Metrics
tags.description: **System monitoring** → Source performance (Plex/Jellyfin/TMDB response times), cache hit rates, device status. Useful for diagnostics.

tags.name: Auto-Update
tags.description: **GitHub Releases integration** for automatic updates via PM2. Check GET /api/github/latest, apply POST /api/admin/github/update.

tags.name: GitHub Integration
tags.description: **Release management** → Fetch releases GET /api/admin/github/releases, trigger updates. Uses GitHub API with rate limiting (60 req/hour).

tags.name: Documentation
tags.description: **API reference** at /api-docs (ReDoc). Download OpenAPI spec GET /api-docs/swagger.json.

tags.name: Site Server
tags.description: **Static assets** including favicon, manifest, robots.txt. Supports PWA installation.

get.description:
Fetches the non-sensitive configuration needed by the frontend for display logic.

This endpoint returns configuration settings for:
- Display mode intervals and transitions
- Available media sources and libraries
- UI customization options
- Device-specific overrides

The response is cached for 30 seconds to improve performance.

Returns the aggregated playlist from all configured media sources (Plex, Jellyfin, TMDB).

Features:
- Cached for performance
- Supports source filtering (plex, jellyfin, tmdb, local)
- Music Mode: Returns music albums instead of movies/TV shows
- Games Mode: Returns game covers from RomM
- Optional extras: Trailers and theme music URLs

The playlist is automatically shuffled and filtered based on configuration.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Optional source filter to return only items from a specific provider

parameters.name: nocache
parameters.description: Set to '1' to bypass cache (admin use)

parameters.name: musicMode
parameters.description: Set to "1" or "true" to return music albums instead of movies/TV shows. Requires wallartMode.musicMode.enabled=true in config.

parameters.name: gamesOnly
parameters.description: Set to "1" or "true" to return game covers from RomM. Requires wallartMode.gamesOnly=true in config.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of items to return (used with musicMode and gamesOnly)

parameters.name: includeExtras
parameters.description: When true, enriches items with trailers and theme music URLs. Adds latency as it fetches additional metadata per item.

200.description: Playlist of media items. When includeExtras=true, items include extras array with trailers and theme URLs.

202.description: Playlist is being built. Client should retry in a few seconds.

example.message: The count parameter must be between 1 and 1000
Failed to fetch media from configured sources

get.description:
Retrieves a single media item by its unique key.

The key format is: `{type}-{serverName}-{itemId}`
- Examples: `plex-My Server-12345`, `jellyfin-MainServer-67890`

This endpoint is typically used when a user clicks on a 'recently added' item
that isn't in the main playlist cache.

post.summary: Check device authentication and registration status
post.description:
Verify device credentials and registration status. Used by clients to confirm their stored ID/secret are valid.

**Flexible Authentication**: This endpoint accepts checks with only deviceId, hardwareId, or installId (without secret)
to determine if a device is registered. When a secret is provided, it validates the credentials.

**Response behavior**:
- Device not found: Returns `{valid: false, isRegistered: false, reason: 'device_not_found'}`
- Device exists, no secret: Returns `{valid: false, isRegistered: true, deviceId, reason: 'secret_required'}`
- Invalid secret: Returns 401 `{valid: false, error: 'invalid_secret'}`
- Valid credentials: Returns `{valid: true, isRegistered: true, deviceId}`

deviceId.description: Device ID (optional if hardwareId or installId provided)

200.description: Device check completed (see response body for valid/isRegistered status)

valid.description: Whether the provided credentials are valid

isRegistered.description: Whether the device is registered in the system
